title: Ask Chris Black: Ideas for Slightly Elevated Sweatpants I Can Wear in Public?
text:
11 items in this article 1 item on sale! Photo: Christy Bush

If you’re looking for the most powerful hair dryer or the handiest chef’s knife, those things can be easy enough to find. Other objects of desire are a little more taste-based. What’s the next status water bottle or hand wash, for instance? Chris Black (he’s a partner at brand consultancy Public Announcement) is here to help, in the form of a regular column. If you have a burning question about the next fanny pack or Noah rugby shirt, drop us an email with the subject line “Ask Chris” at strategist@nymag.com.

Now that summer is over and it’s time to bundle up, I am looking for a clean pair of sweatpants. Something slightly elevated that can be worn out of the house, neutral enough to go with everything, and ideally less than $300. What do you suggest?

﻿First, we must tackle the most significant issue that comes along with this historically beloved garment. We have all seen it, some of us have even suffered from it: The Dreaded Outline™. Unfortunately, the humble cotton sweatpant can show off, well, more than you’d like to. It happened to Steve McQueen, and it will happen to you if you aren’t careful. I will suggest some chic pairs — but wear them knowing you must do your best to spare your friends, family, and colleagues from seeing more than they would like. Comfort can come with a price!

A.P.C. Adam Slim-Fit Tapered Logo-Print Loopback Cotton-Jersey Sweatpants This loopback cotton-jersey pair from A.P.C. is tapered, making them a little easier to wear in public. It also has a subtle, retro-inspired logo, if you are into that sort of thing. $190 at Mr Porter Buy

Sunspel Slim-Fit Fleece-Back Cotton and Cashmere-Blend Jersey Sweatpants Sunspel always does it right. These slim-fit, fleece-back sweatpants are cut from a very luxurious-sounding cotton-and-cashmere-blend jersey, come in a fall-appropriate army green, and are within our budget. Go ahead and get the extra scone. You deserve it. $285 at Mr Porter Buy

Dries Van Noten Slim-Fit Loopback Cotton-Jersey Sweatpants Both of the above pairs are great, but this navy pair from Dries Van Noten is probably my favorite in the $300-and-under category. The key is the polished silver zippers on the pockets, which will ensure personal effects stay secure. There’s nothing chic about losing your wallet. $295 at Mr Porter Buy

The Row Olin Cotton-Jersey Sweatpants If you are willing to splurge, I’d strongly consider these simple black drawstring sweatpants made with buttery Japanese cotton-jersey from The Row. You could even wear them to the opera! $590 at Mr Porter Buy

Stone Island Logo-Appliquéd Garment-Dyed Fleece-Back David-TC Sweatpants Or, get LOUD baby. These garment-dyed Pepto pink sweats from my guys at Stone Island will for sure have heads turning at the dog run. They’re straight leg, with an anti-drop, water-resistant coating, and zipper pockets. Sometimes you gotta flex! $590 at Mr Porter Buy

I recently upgraded to the iPhone 11. It’s a lot larger than my old iPhone, and I’m terrified of a cracked screen. Can you recommend some cases that are sleek enough to fit in Levi’s 501 pockets, but also offer some protection?

﻿I hate phone cases, and have often said that they comprise the aesthetic of the device’s excellent design! But when your phone has three cameras and costs $1,000, you would be a fool not to protect it.

Peel Super Thin iPhone 11 Pro Case A few years ago, I discovered Peel via a targeted Instagram ad (SMFH), and I copped. It is the definition of “barely there,” the price is right ($29!), and it fits in the pocket comfortably. If you fumble your phone and the case gets dinged, you buy another one, and it’s like new! Peel also makes a great glass protector. $29 at Peel Buy

OtterBox Commuter Series Case for iPhone 11 If you are a real klutz, I guess you need a big boy Otterbox. It does not fit nicely in the pocket, but chances are your jeans are less expensive to replace than your shiny new phone. $36 at Amazon Buy $36 at Amazon Buy

As we head into fall, can you recommend the chicest sneakers for women? I’m looking for pairs to wear while running errands/hanging with friends on the weekends, not for working out.

﻿Instead of boldly attempting to mansplain sneakers, I thought it would make more sense to once again call on my deep bullpen of brilliant and tasteful friends. To answer this query, I went all the way across the pond to tap London-based editor and consultant Emma Hope Allwood — who is currently the head of fashion at Dazed Digital, and a contributor to Strategist U.K. And I must say … she killed it. Emma, take it from here!

Nike White Shox Total Sneakers Shox are back, baby. After Comme des Garçons released a now sold-out take on the discontinued early aughts silhouette, the style is having a comeback. Get this silver and white pair if all black makes you feel too much like a “goes to Berlin once” starter-pack meme. $170 at ASOS Buy $153 at Nike Buy

Salomon Black Limited Edition S/Lab XT-6 Softground LT ADV Sneakers Technical sneakers — the kind that look like they were made for people who actually enjoy going outside in all weather conditions — are having a moment. Spotted everywhere at Fashion Week, Salomon’s S/Lab models marry the French outdoors brand’s nerdy knowledge with a sleeker silhouette. [Editor’s note: The sneakers at the link below are listed in men’s sizes, but according to Salomon, the S/Lab Xt-6s are unisex, and SSENSE is one of few retailers with multiple sizes in stock.] $220 at SSENSE Buy

Photo: Courtesy of the retailer Aries x New Balance 991 Sneakers A last gasp of dad-shoe mania, this version of the New Balance 991 by London slacker-chic legends Aries comes in winter-blues-busting neon yellow. [Editor’s note: These sneakers will be released on October 25, and you can sign up to “shop first” once they’re available via the link below.] $285 at Aries Buy

description: Our columnist recommends stylish men’s sweatpants that you can wear on your couch or to meet friends, from brands including A.P.C., The Row, and Stone Island, plus sleek-but-protective iPhone 11 cases and women’s (non-workout) sneakers for fall.
